intro: Vilfa vaginiflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has a woody stem that becomes more pronounced with age, and its leaves are typically covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. Vilfa vaginiflora is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
